"The devastation that Russia is trying to inflict on Ukraine is large," she said. There has been no official confirmation that thermobaric weapon has been used in the conflict in Ukraine.

175.title: Ashneer Grover quits as BharatPe MD, says 'I'm being forced to bid adieu'
175.article_body: BharatPe's Ashneer Grover, who's in a tussle with the board over a governance review, has resigned as MD and director. In his letter, Ashneer said, "I write this with a heavy heart as...I'm being forced to bid adieu to a company of which I'm a Founder." Earlier, his wife Madhuri was fired as Head of Controls on funds misappropriation allegations.

176.title: 4 alleged media persons extort money from woman in Ujjain, booked
176.article_body: Four alleged media persons have been booked for extorting money and valuables from a woman in Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh. The accused, who're all on the run, have been identified as Shubham Bamne, Pooja Solanki, Dharmendra Parmar and Omprakash Pal. The group had allegedly extorted cash and other items from a house after receiving information about a sex racket running there.

177.title: Duo posing as police flee with man's gold chain in Powai, booked
177.article_body: Two persons have been booked for cheating a senior citizen in Powai by posing as police and running away with his gold chain. The duo had caught the 60-year-old retired BMP employee without a mask and questioned him before fleeing with his chain worth ₹45,000 on Sunday morning. A case was registered under relevant sections of the Indian Penal Code.

178.title: Viral magazine covers showing Putin with Nazi symbol, Hitler moustache are fake
178.article_body: Two photoshopped images purporting to show Russian President Vladimir Putin as German dictator Adolf Hitler on the cover of TIME magazine, have been going viral online, amid Russian invasion of Ukraine. One of the covers features Hitler's eyes merged with Putin's face with a swastika. The other one shows Hitler's iconic toothbrush moustache on Putin's face.

179.title: Ukrainian soldiers who told Russian warship 'go f*** yourself' are alive: Navy
179.article_body:
A group of 13 Ukrainian soldiers thought to have died while defending an island in the Black Sea after telling a Russian warship to “go f*** yourself”, are alive and well, confirmed the Ukrainian navy. 
However, they have been illegally captured by the Russians, it added. They were thought to have been among the first victims of the Russian invasion.

180.title: PMC to construct 100 MT solid waste management plant in Pune
180.article_body: A solid waste management project is to be set up at a ten-acre independent plot of Cantonment Board located in Pune's Hadapsar Industrial Estate. The project has been approved by the Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) for a cost of ₹20 crore. Out of the total, ₹7.50 crore have been sanctioned for constructing a 100 metric tonne processing plant.

181.title: FIFA & UEFA suspend Russia from all international football competitions
181.article_body: FIFA and UEFA have suspended Russian teams from international football competitions "until further notice" amid its invasion of Ukraine. The FIFA World Cup was scheduled to be held in Qatar later this year. UEFA will also cancel its sponsorship deal with the Russian gas company, Gazprom. "Football is in full solidarity with...the people affected in Ukraine," read their statement.

182.title: Defeat BJP to get rid of inflation: Chhattisgarh CM
182.article_body: Ahead of the sixth phase of the Uttar Pradesh elections, Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel on Monday urged the people of the state to defeat BJP to get rid of inflation. While addressing a gathering in UP's Sardarnagar area, he said, "The rates of diesel and petrol will skyrocket after the elections are over." He added, "Mehengai hatao, bhajpa harao."

183.title: NCP, Cong protest against Maha Guv's remarks on Shivaji Maharaj
183.article_body: The NCP and Congress on Monday held agitations in Pune to protest against the remarks made by Maharashtra governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari in Aurangabad. Koshyari, while speaking on importance of teachers, had allegedly stated that Samarth Ramdas was the guru of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj. Meanwhile, BJP MP Udayanraje Bhonsle, who is a descendent of Shivaji, also criticised the statement.

184.title: Delhi reports 258 COVID-19 cases & zero deaths in last 24 hrs
184.article_body: Delhi reported 258 new COVID-19 cases and no related death in the last 24 hours, taking the overall infection tally in the city to 18,59,892. Moreover, 499 recoveries were reported in the national capital, with the city currently having 1,845 active cases. With no death in the last 24 hours, the fatality count in Delhi remains at 26,122.

185.title: Bureaucrats from UP & Guj rule people of J&K today: Rahul Gandhi
185.article_body: While addressing a gathering in Chennai, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said that bureaucrats from Uttar Pradesh and Gujarat rule the people of Jammu and Kashmir today. He further said, "In Punjab, they unilaterally took away 100 km of land and gave it to the Border Security Force (BSF)." Gandhi added that Congress' vision is "unity in diversity."

186.title: Akhilesh protected, embraced terrorists as CM of UP: JP Nadda
186.article_body: While addressing a rally in Uttar Pradesh's Mirzapur, BJP president Jagat Prakash Nadda said that Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav 'protected and embraced terrorists' during his tenure as the Chief Minister of UP. Nadda said that BJP has taken strict measures against such elements after 2017. There's a rule of law in UP now, he further added.

187.title: Policeman attacked by suspected militants in J&K's Srinagar
187.article_body: A police inspector was attacked by suspected militants in the Batamaloo area of J&K's Srinagar on Monday, police said. The policeman, identified as Sheikh Firdous, was returning from a local mosque after offering prayers when he was fired upon, police added. He is currently undergoing treatment at a hospital and his condition is said to be stable.

188.title: 28 more Bihar students return from Ukraine on Monday
188.article_body: Twenty-eight more students from Bihar arrived in Patna on Monday from Ukraine, just a day after 23 students from the state returned home. According to Patna district administration officials, the students arrived in three batches. Patna district magistrate Dr Chandrashekhar Singh said all returnees were provided free of cost vehicles to transport them to their respective native places.

189.title: PM running 'Mission Ganga', Akhilesh ran 'Mission Dangas': MP CM
189.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan while addressing a rally in Jaunpur on Monday, claimed that "700 riots" took place in UP during Akhilesh Yadav's rule. Further describing the Samajwadi Party chief as "Dangesh" he said, "PM Modi running 'Mission Ganga' (to evacuate Indians from Ukraine) while Akhilesh ran 'Mission Dangas' (riots)." Chouhan had earlier compared Akhilesh to Aurangzeb.

190.title: UN Security Council imposes arms embargo on Yemen's Houthi rebels
190.article_body: UN Security Council on Monday imposed an arms embargo on Iran-backed Houthi rebel groups of Yemen. Proposed by UAE, the measure expands a targeted embargo on several Houthi leaders to the whole group. This comes after the group claimed multiple drone and missile attacks in UAE and Saudi Arabia this year. With 11 votes in favour, the resolution was passed.

191.title: Burman family makes offer to buy additional 26% stake in Eveready
191.article_body: Eveready's single-largest investor Burman family on Monday said it made an open offer to buy an additional 26% stake, or 18.9 million shares, for ₹604.76 crore in Eveready Industries Ltd. The mandatory open offer under the takeover regulations was made as the Burmans acquired an additional 5.26% share of Eveready for ₹122.30 crore, taking their total shareholding to 25.11%.

192.title: My soulmate left me today: Chef Vikas Khanna shares post after sister's death
192.article_body: Chef Vikas Khanna on Monday shared a post to mourn the death of his sister, Radhika Khanna. Sharing a photo, Khanna wrote, "My soulmate left me today...She fought like a champion for years with Lupus, aHUS, renal failure. But today due to multiple organ failures, my best friend passed away in my arms. Loveeeee you Radha forever & forever. RIP."

193.title: In a policy shift, Finland to send weapons to Ukraine amid invasion
193.article_body: Finland will send weapons and ammunition to Ukraine amid ongoing Russian military offensive, PM Sanna Marin said on Monday. The shipment will include 2,500 assault rifles,1,50,000 bullets, 1,500 anti-tank weapons and 70,000 food packages, Defence Minister Antti Kaikkonen said. The decision comes as a policy shift for Finland which has remained militarily neutral since end of World War II.

194.title: Very unusual of him: Gavaskar on Rohit's dismissal in 3rd T20I vs SL
194.article_body: Referring to captain Rohit Sharma's dismissal in third T20I against Sri Lanka, ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said it was "a strange and completely uncharacteristic innings" right from the first ball. "He was looking to play on the onside maybe. He's very disappointed...in this occasion, Rohit was looking to hit every ball, which is unusual," Gavaskar added. Rohit scored nine-ball five.

195.title: 600 CCTVs placed at Chandni Chowk to check encroachment: Police
195.article_body: Over 600 CCTVs have been installed at Chandni Chowk to monitor illegal vendors, Delhi Police Commissioner Rakesh Asthana told the Delhi High Court on Monday. He also said that a control room would monitor the feed 24 hours every day. He further said that they would install similar cameras under Safe City Project in Delhi in the future.

196.title: UP no longer wants to be driven by casteism: PM at Ballia rally
196.article_body: PM Narendra Modi arrived in Ballia on Monday to address voters and spoke about people rejecting "dynasty politics". He further said, "[The] vehicle of UP is no longer going to get stuck in...streets of caste as it has gained momentum on...highway of development." He added he has an "emotional connect" with Ballia as the Ujjwala scheme was launched from there.

197.title: Serena Williams: Sharapova on her toughest opponent
197.article_body: Terming Serena Williams as toughest competitor she's ever faced, ex-world number one Maria Sharapova said the 23-time Grand Slam champion was the most challenging and consistent in her level. Serena has a 20-2 career record over Sharapova. She won the last 19 meetings in a row. Notably, it's the longest active winning streak over a single player on WTA Tour.

198.title: TRS leader Sajid Khan, booked for raping 15-yr-old girl, expelled
198.article_body: Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) leader Sheikh Sajid Khan, who's on the run after being accused of rape by a 15-year-old girl, has been expelled from the party. The announcement was made by TRS on Monday, just a day after police registered a sexual assault case against Khan. Police said they're searching for him and shall "arrest him at the earliest".

199.title: EU to hold summit with China on April 1 to defuse tensions: Official
199.article_body: European Commission Vice-President Valdis Dombrovskis on Monday said that the European Union (EU) will hold a summit with China on April 1 in an attempt to defuse growing tensions between the two. "We know we're in a complicated phase of relations with China," he added. Notably, the EU regards China as a strategic rival in some fields, according to Reuters.

200.title: Students from TN, T'gana & K'taka stuck in Ukraine break down, seek help
200.article_body: Videos of Indian students stranded in Ukraine are circulating on social media. The students, reportedly from Tamil Nadu, Telangana and Karnataka can be seen breaking down on camera while describing their condition. In one of the videos, some Tamil Nadu students can be seen pleading with the government to evacuate them while talking about "acute shortage of food and water".

201.title: Nuclear conflict inconceivable: UN chief on Russia-Ukraine conflict
201.article_body: Speaking at the emergency session of the United Nations General Assembly over the Russia-Ukraine conflict on Monday, UN Secretary-General António Guterres said, "The mere idea of a nuclear conflict is simply inconceivable." Notably, Guterres was speaking in reference to Russia putting its nuclear deterrent forces on high alert amid the conflict. Guterres also called it a "chilling development".

202.title: It's a lovely journey, we are growing: Dulquer on wife Amal
202.article_body: Actor Dulquer Salmaan has said it has been a lovely journey with his wife Amal Sufiya and they both are growing and learning about each other. "I completed 10 years in the industry and...10 years of marriage as well," he said. "It's about realising what keeps you together, what you want in your life together," he added.

203.title: Pop artiste Rose tests positive for COVID-19, cancels some tours
203.article_body: Pop artiste Rose, part of the South Korean pop group Blackpink, has tested positive for COVID-19, the label handling the group said in a statement on Monday. "As a result, some of her overseas schedules have been cancelled," the statement said. Rose was to travel overseas for her tour this week.

204.title: Rock band Green Day cancels Moscow concert over Ukraine crisis
204.article_body: American rock band Green Day has decided to cancel its upcoming concert in Moscow in the wake of Russia's military operation in Ukraine. "We are aware that this moment is not about stadium rock shows, it's much bigger than that...Refunds available at the point of purchase," the band said in a statement. The concert was earlier scheduled for May 29.

205.title: Man flees after attempting to rape 7-yr-old girl in Ludhiana; booked
205.article_body: A man has been booked for attempting to rape a seven-year-old girl in Ludhiana. The incident took place on February 23 in Rasulpur village in Jagraon, following which the accused ran away from the scene. The victim's father, who lodged a complaint with police, said he had found the man trying to undress the minor while in an inebriated condition.

206.title: Russia's Medvedev replaces Djokovic as world number one men's tennis player
206.article_body: Russia's Daniil Medvedev has officially replaced Novak Djokovic as world number one men's tennis player. Medvedev is the third Russian to become world number one men's tennis player after Yevgeny Kafelnikov and Marat Safin. The 6-foot-6-inch tall player is the tallest men's player to become world number one in the history of ATP rankings.

207.title: Will Smith, Jessica Chastain win best actor awards at SAG Awards 2022
207.article_body: Actors Will Smith and Jessica Chastain were awarded Outstanding Performance by a Male and Female Actor in a Leading Role respectively at the SAG Awards 2022. Will won for his performance in 'King Richard' while Jessica was awarded for her role in 'The Eyes of Tammy Faye'. The film 'CODA' won Outstanding Performance by a Cast in a Motion Picture.

208.title: Lee Jung Jae, Jung Ho Yeon win SAG Awards 2022 for 'Squid Game'
208.article_body: Actor Lee Jung Jae has won the award for Outstanding Performance by a Male Actor in a Drama Series for 'Squid Game' at the SAG Awards 2022. Actress Jung Ho Yeon received the Outstanding Performance by a Female Actor in a Drama Series. The South Korean series also won in the Outstanding Action Performance as a Stunt Ensemble category.

209.title: It's truly awful: Brian Cox on Russia's invasion of Ukraine
209.article_body: At the Screen Actors Guild Awards 2022, 'Succession' actor Brian Cox termed Russian invasion of Ukraine as "truly awful". "It's particularly awful in terms of [how] it's affecting people, particularly in our profession," he said. "But the thing that really distressed me is what's happening in Russia to my fellow actors...they cannot say a word about Ukraine," Brian added.

210.title: We came with mindset to enjoy every moment: Wiese on PSL win
210.article_body: Lahore Qalandars all-rounder David Wiese said his side came with a mindset of enjoying every moment in Pakistan Super League (PSL) final after winning their maiden title with a 42-run victory against Multan Sultans on Sunday. "We had beaten Multan before in the tournament and we took confidence from that, but also it's a final...anything can happen," he added.

211.title: Centre committed towards development of North-East: Union Minister
211.article_body: Union Minister of Jal Shakti Gajendra Singh Shekhawat on Monday said that the Centre is committed to the development of the North-Eastern region. While addressing the conference of State Ministers of North-Eastern Region on Jal Jeevan Mission (JJM) and Swachh Bharat Mission in Guwahati, he said the state should give emphasis on maintaining quality while implementing JJM in the region.

212.title: Odisha govt bans Holi celebration in public places
212.article_body: The Odisha government on Monday banned the Holi celebration in public places and restricted large gatherings during festivals. "People may celebrate Holi with family members in their houses only," an order issued by the state government said. Local authorities would ensure proper adherence to the COVID-19 appropriate guidelines on Mahashivratri, Holi and Dol Purnima, the order added.

213.title: Indian refuses to leave Ukraine after not being allowed to bring pet dog
213.article_body: Indian engineering student Rishabh Kaushik has refused to leave war-hit Ukraine after being unable to get NOC from the Indian government to bring his pet dog 'Malibu' with him. Kaushik, who's in an underground bunker in Kyiv, rescued the puppy last year. He said he's been in touch with the Indian embassy since February 18 to get the necessary documents.

214.title: TikTok now allows 10-minute-long videos on the app
214.article_body: TikTok has started rolling out the ability that allows users to upload videos that are up to 10 minutes long. TikTok, which began as a 15-second video app, has been gradually increasing the maximum time limit for videos and last increased the limit to 3 minutes in July 2021. Owned by Chinese internet conglomerate ByteDance, TikTok remains banned in India.

215.title: Govt must share evacuation plan with Indians in Ukraine: Rahul
215.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday said that the Centre must urgently share the detailed evacuation plan with Indians stranded in Ukraine, as well as with their families. Referring to a video in which the Ukrainian Army can be seen using force against the Indian students, he said, "We can't abandon our own people. No parent should go through this."

216.title: Man steals motorcycle during test ride in Punjab's Ludhiana
216.article_body: A man pretending to buy a second-hand motorcycle stole it during a test ride in Punjab's Ludhiana. The complainant, who owned the bike, Yamaha R15, had posted an advertisement on a social networking site. The accused came to his house and asked him to go for a test ride first, but he did not return.

217.title: I've made many mistakes in my life, have been misunderstood: Poonam
217.article_body: Actor-model Poonam Pandey has said that she's not controversial at all in real life. While interacting with 'Lock Upp' host Kangana Ranaut in the first episode, Poonam said, "I am a normal person...I have made a lot of mistakes in my life...I have been misunderstood." Actress Nisha Rawal and comedian Munawar Faruqui are among the other contestants in the show.

218.title: Biden to host ASEAN leaders for summit in March in US: White House
218.article_body: The White House on Monday said that President Joe Biden will host the leaders of the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) for a special summit in the US from March 28-29. "It's a top priority for the Biden-Harris Administration to serve as a...reliable partner...to...ASEAN," it added. Notably, the summit was announced amid growing concerns about China in the US.

219.title: 'Putin forcing us to lie,' reads message on Russian media sites after hack
219.article_body: Several Russian media outlets, including state-owned TASS, were hacked on Monday. An anti-war message was posted on the homepage of these websites, with calls to stop Russian President Vladimir Putin's invasion of Ukraine. "Dear citizens. We urge you to stop this madness, don't send your sons and husbands to certain death. Putin is forcing us to lie," the message read.

220.title: Solanki to continue playing Ranji despite losing daughter, dad in span of 2 weeks
220.article_body: Baroda batter Vishnu Solanki has decided to carry on playing Ranji Trophy despite losing his father and one-day-old daughter in a span of two weeks. Solanki lost his daughter on February 12. He returned to the team on February 17 and scored a hundred on February 25. He would feature in Baroda's next match despite losing his father on Sunday.

221.title: 10 Assam students evacuated from Ukraine, state opens helplines
221.article_body: Ten students from Assam who were stranded in war-torn Ukraine have been evacuated along with other Indians, the state government said. Two of the 10 students who have been evacuated arrived in Mumbai, and the others in New Delhi. Meanwhile, the Assam Police issued helpline numbers +91 6026900968 and +91 6026901060 (both WhatsApp) for assistance.

222.title: Will not allow weapons for Ukraine to transit our territory: Hungary
222.article_body: Hungarian Foreign Minister Péter Szijjártó on Monday said that Hungary will not send troops or weapons to Ukraine and will not allow lethal weapons to transit its territory in order to keep the country safe. "The reason...is that such deliveries might become targets of hostile military action," he added. "We are not getting involved in that war," he further said.

223.title: President Zelenskyy signs application for Ukraine to join European Union
223.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Monday signed an application for Ukraine to join the European Union. Earlier today, Zelenskyy had urged the EU to allow Ukraine to gain membership under a special procedure immediately amid the Russian invasion. "Our goal is to be with all Europeans and, most importantly, to be equal...I am sure we deserve it," he said.

224.title: Hearing good things about Bobby's performance in Love Hostel: Salman
224.article_body: Actor Salman Khan took to Instagram and said that he's hearing good things about actor Bobby Deol's performance in the film 'Love Hostel'. "Best wishes always and hope you keep doing better and better," Salman further wrote. Bobby and Salman worked together in the 2018 film 'Race 3'. Actors Vikrant Massey and Sanya Malhotra also feature in 'Love Hostel'.

225.title: Remarkable feat: Babar on Shaheen-led Lahore Qalandars winning 1st PSL title
225.article_body: Following Lahore Qalandars' maiden Pakistan Super League (PSL) title win, Pakistan captain Babar Azam congratulated them, saying it's a "remarkable feat" achieved by captain Shaheen Shah Afridi. "Amazing display of performance by both teams...I want to thank the fans for making PSL a hit!" he tweeted. Chasing a 181-run target, Multan Sultans were bowled out for 138 in 19.3 overs.

226.title: Out for a swim, 3 teens drown in stream in Andhra's Prakasam
226.article_body: Three teenagers, who went for a swim in a stream, drowned in Andhra Pradesh's Prakasam district, the police said on Monday. "Apparently, they did not gauge the depth of the stream, which was about 10 feet, and drowned within minutes," Tangutur Sub-Inspector Khadar Basha said. The bodies have been shifted to a local government hospital for a post-mortem examination.

227.title: Condition of Indian students pathetic: MP girl stuck in Ukraine
227.article_body: A student of Sumy State Medical University in Ukraine, Ishika Sarkar, who hails from Madhya Pradesh, sought help from the government of India, stating that the condition of Indian students in Ukraine has "become very pathetic". "They are spending time in bunkers in a very pathetic condition. Soon there will be crises of food, electricity and mobile network," she said.

228.title: Landslide in U'khand's Rudraprayag, families taken to safer areas
228.article_body: A landslide occurred in the hilly Jhalimath village in Uttarakhand's Rudraprayag on Monday. Several cowsheds and toilets were damaged in the incident, prompting the administration to shift 11 families to safer places. A chunk of the slope beneath the village slid several hundred metres down to the banks of the Alaknanda river, District Disaster Management Officer Nandan Singh said.

229.title: I'm praying for the people in Ukraine: Actress Angelina Jolie
229.article_body: After Russia invaded Ukraine on Thursday, Hollywood actress Angelina Jolie took to Instagram and wrote that she is praying for the people in Ukraine. "My focus along with my UNHCR colleagues is that everything possible is done to ensure the protection and basic human rights of those displaced, and refugees in the region," she added.

230.title: Poland-Lithuania gas link to open earlier amid Russia supply worries
230.article_body: A natural gas pipeline linking Poland and Lithuania is set to open on May 1, earlier than its scheduled start. The GIPL pipeline's inaugural was preponed due to concerns of disrupted Russian gas supply to Europe, following its invasion of Ukraine. Europe is dependent on Russia for over 35% of its natural gas, most of which is transported via pipelines.

231.title: Shaheen you're a champion: Shahid on Lahore Qalandars' PSL title win
231.article_body: Calling Lahore Qalandars captain Shaheen Shah Afridi a "champion" after he led his side to their maiden Pakistan Super League (PSL) title, ex-Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi took to Twitter to congratulate the "amazing" team. "The entire Qalandars squad and in fact, the entire Lahore deserves this! Buhut Mubarak," he wrote. Lahore Qalandars beat Multan Sultans by 42 runs on Sunday.

232.title: Russia bans residents from transferring money abroad from March 1
232.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has ordered a ban on foreign exchange loans and transfers by its residents to outside of the country from March 1, in response to the economic sanctions imposed by the West. It also prohibits companies from buying back their own stocks. This comes after Russia banned flights from 36 countries in a retaliatory move against EU.

233.title: BJP hatching conspiracy to end reservation: Akhilesh Yadav
233.article_body: While addressing a meeting in the Jalalpur Assembly constituency, Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav said, "The BJP is hatching a conspiracy to end reservation, and hence it is selling government organisations to the private sector." He further said the people of Uttar Pradesh have rejected BJP in the first five phases of UP polls.

234.title: I'm a player's captain, now more experienced: KKR skipper Shreyas
234.article_body: Newly-appointed Kolkata Knight Riders skipper Shreyas Iyer said he's a player's captain and wants to create an atmosphere in the team where everyone would be thinking only about winning. "I'm now more mature and experienced in terms of my decision-making and captaincy skills," he added. Shreyas was bought by KKR for ₹12.25 crore in the recent IPL mega auction.

235.title: Russia's economic reality has considerably changed: Russian govt
235.article_body: Speaking about the economic measures taken against Russia by other countries over invasion of Ukraine, the Russian government said, "The economic reality has considerably changed." "These are heavy sanctions...but Russia has the potential to offset the harm," it added. Russia has been making plans for quite a long time for possible sanctions, including the most severe ones, it further said.

236.title: 'Europeans with blue eyes, blonde hair being killed', says Ukraine official; criticised
236.article_body: While talking about the current Russia-Ukraine conflict, Ukraine's Deputy Chief Prosecutor David Sakvarelidze said, "It's really emotional for me because I see European people with blue eyes and blonde hair being killed...with (Russian President) Vladimir Putin's missiles." Sakvarelidze has been criticised for the statement with many calling it 'racist' and indicative of 'white supremacy'.

237.title: India needs to be powerful in fast-changing world: PM Modi in UP
237.article_body: While addressing voters in UP's Maharajganj, PM Narendra Modi spoke about the need for the country to remain powerful in the fast-changing world. He said, "You're witnessing the situation of a fast-changing world in...last two years. [The] world is going through several challenges....Nobody can remain untouched from this. Under this situation, it's very important for India to be powerful."

238.title: Slovakia sends missiles, rockets to Ukraine amid war with Russia
238.article_body: Slovakian Defence Minister Jaroslav Nad on Monday said Slovakia delivered two batches of supplies worth €15.4 million, including 486 air-defence missiles and anti-tank rockets to Ukraine. This comes as Russia launched a full-scale invasion of Ukraine on February 24 killing at least 352 civilians including 14 children. Nad added the country also sent 120mm artillery ammunition and fuel.

239.title: Sudan's key pro-democracy groups release 1st political charter
239.article_body: The main pro-democracy groups of Sudan on Sunday released a political charter for the first time, aiming to unify factions and bring democracy. As per charter, an appointed PM will serve as head of state and military commander-in-chief for a transition period of 2 years until a constitution is ratified. Sudan plunged into crisis after military coup in October 2021.

240.title: Estée Lauder fires senior exec Demsey for posting racist meme on Instagram
240.article_body: The Estée Lauder Companies has fired Executive Group President John Demsey for posting a meme on his Instagram account that contained a racial slur and a joke about COVID-19. The company said Demsey's Instagram posts caused "widespread offence". Demsey, who oversees brands like Clinique and Mac, had apologised last week for "carelessly reposting a racist meme without reading it beforehand."

241.title: Heroin worth ₹70 lakh seized in Haryana, 9 arrested
241.article_body: Haryana Police has arrested nine people from Jind and Sirsa districts in separate cases and seized heroin worth around ₹70 lakh from them. Of the total 669 grams seized, 514 grams of heroin was recovered from two of the accused near Belarkhan village. Preliminary probe revealed the drugs were to be supplied in Narwana, Sangrur and Patiala areas, police said.

242.title: Switzerland bans entry of 5 Russian oligarchs close to Putin
242.article_body: Swiss Justice Minister Karin Keller-Sutter on Monday said government banned five Russian oligarchs close to Russian President Vladimir Putin from entering the country. This comes after the neutral nation adopted sanctions imposed by EU against Russia after it mounted a full-scale invasion of Ukraine on February 24. However, the minister did not name the oligarchs citing privacy concerns.

243.title: Filmmaker Luv Ranjan shares first pics of wedding with Alisha
243.article_body: Filmmaker Luv Ranjan on Monday took to social media to share the first pictures of his wedding with his longtime girlfriend Alisha Vaid. The couple got married on February 20 in Agra. Their wedding was attended by actors Kartik Aaryan, Ranbir Kapoor, Shraddha Kapoor, Rakul Preet Singh, Jackky Bhagnani, Arjun Kapoor and Varun Sharma, among others.

244.title: Ukraine to pay its soldiers ₹2.5 lakh per month for fighting Russian troops
244.article_body: Ukraine has announced that its soldiers will be paid 100,000 hryvnias per month (around ₹2.5 lakh) for defending against Russian forces. Families of deceased servicemen will be paid a lump sum amount of 15 million UAH (around ₹3.7 crore). As per the President, this isn't done to be thanked but to tell the defenders that Ukraine is grateful to them.

245.title: Sick, filthy: Gauahar on channel saying she fought with Shibani over Farhan
245.article_body: Gauahar Khan has criticised a news channel for reporting that she fought with Shibani Dandekar over a crush on Farhan Akhtar calling it filthy and sick. "Be...absolutely ashamed that in a time [of] war...some parts of...media...can't stop lying," she tweeted. Gauahar further wrote that she said all contestants of reality show 'I Can Do That' were crushing on host Farhan.

246.title: BSF airlifts 3 patients from J&K's snow-covered Kupwara
246.article_body: Three patients requiring immediate medical attention were airlifted by BSF from J&K's snow-covered Kupwara district on Monday. The Public Relations Officer of Kashmir Frontier said the district administration had made a special request for their evacuation as the only road passing through Sadhna top was closed. "We're always there to serve people of Kashmir," IG of BSF Kashmir said.

247.title: After calling Vikrant 'cockroach', Kangana wishes him on marrying a Himachali
247.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut wished actor Vikrant Massey on marrying Sheetal Thakur on Instagram, commenting, "Hmm Vikrant ji marrying a Himachali girl is good karma. Wish you both a happy married life." She had earlier called Vikrant a 'cockroach' after he commented on actress Yami Gautam's picture dressed in traditional Himachali bridal attire writing, "Pure and pious like Radhe Maa."

248.title: Delhi HC refuses to entertain plea to change title of 'Prithviraj'
248.article_body: The Delhi High Court on Monday refused to entertain a plea seeking to modify the title of Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Prithviraj'. The bench of judges said that they were inclined to dismiss the plea with costs after which the plea was withdrawn. The submitted plea had stated that Prithviraj was a great emperor and the title should be more respectful.

249.title: Don't feed stray dogs, monkeys on court premises: Delhi High Court
249.article_body: The Delhi High Court on Monday directed advocates, litigants, staff members and security personnel to not feed stray animals like monkeys and dogs within its premises. The court said that it had come to notice that some advocates, litigants, staff members and security personnel were still feeding stray animals in spite of directions issued against it.

250.title: Luxembourg to send anti-tank weapons to Ukraine amid war with Russia
250.article_body: Luxembourg Defence Minister François Bausch on Monday said the government will send 100 NLAW anti-tank weapons, jeeps and 15 military tents to Ukraine. This comes after EU on Sunday decided to fund military weapons for Ukraine to help it defend itself against Russian invasion. At least 352 civilians including 14 children were killed since Russia invaded Ukraine on February 24.

251.title: New Zealand to end quarantine curbs for vaccinated arrivals
251.article_body: New Zealand is set to end quarantine curbs for vaccinated nationals returning to the country from Thursday onwards, Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern has said. Incoming travellers will still need to test negative for COVID-19 before leaving and after arriving. The revised rule, however, does not include tourists as New Zealand hasn't opened its borders for international tourism yet.

252.title: Putin is a warmonger, tyrant & also kind of a huge b***h: John Oliver
252.article_body: Talking about Russian President Vladimir Putin, comedian John Oliver said, "He's an autocrat, a tyrant, a warmonger. But also, he's kinda...huge b***h." Oliver's comments were in response to a video of the security meeting where Putin ordered Russia's Foreign Intelligence Service chief Sergei Naryshkin to "speak plainly" on the matter of recognising Donetsk and Luhansk as 'People's Republics'.

253.title: PM Modi chairs 3rd high-level meeting in 24 hours on Russia-Ukraine conflict
253.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi held the third high-level meeting within 24 hours on the Russia-Ukraine conflict, on Monday evening. The meeting was attended by External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar along with Union Ministers Jyotiraditya Scindia, Kiren Rijiju, Hardeep Puri and VK Singh. Scindia, Rijiju, Puri and Singh will be sent to Ukraine's neighbouring nations to oversee Indians' evacuation.

254.title: 8 yrs ago, universe did us a solid: Ankita on anniversary with Milind
254.article_body: Taking to Instagram, actor-model Milind Soman's wife Ankita Konwar shared pictures with the actor to mark eight years of togetherness. "On this day, eight years ago, the universe did us a solid and it continues to work its charm every single day," she captioned the post. Milind and Ankita got married in April 2018 after dating for five years.

255.title: Moldova new land route to evacuate Indians stuck in Ukraine: MEA
255.article_body: Ministry of External Affairs on Monday said a new route through Moldova has been identified for evacuation of Indian nationals stranded in Ukraine. MEA spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said the new route is operational and the Ministry's team is ready to assist those in need. "They will assist in the evacuation of Indians through Romania," Bagchi said.

256.title: Let's not politicise the evacuation process: Ex-PM Devegowda
256.article_body: Former Prime Minister HD Devegowda on Monday said the evacuation of Indians stuck in Ukraine must not be politicised. "It will demoralise those conducting the operation. Scoring points at this hour of crisis will make us look bad," Devegowda said. "It is only fair that we support our officers and embassies to focus on the job at hand," he added.

257.title: BJP crossed majority mark in UP after 5 phases of polls: Shah
257.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Monday claimed the BJP has already gone past the majority mark after the first five phases of polling in the Uttar Pradesh elections. "In the sixth and seventh phases, people have to vote for the BJP to form the government with over 300 seats," he said at an election rally.

258.title: 15 booked after Panchkula trader ends life in Ludhiana hotel
258.article_body: The Ludhiana Police on Sunday booked 15 persons for abetment to suicide after a Panchkula-based trader ended his life over being allegedly harassed by his business associates. Sub-Inspector Jaskanwal Singh Sekhon said the victim was found dead in his hotel room on February 25. The police had found two pills and a suicide note from his room.

259.title: Urgent to end talks to revive Iran nuclear deal this week: France
259.article_body: France's Foreign Ministry on Monday said that it is urgent to end negotiations to revive a 2015 nuclear deal between world powers and Iran this week. The talks are being held in Austria's Vienna. Separately, Iran said that efforts to revive the deal could succeed if the US took a political decision to meet its demands.

260.title: Russian President Putin calls West an 'Empire of Lies' after sanctions
260.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin called the West an "Empire of Lies" following the economic sanctions imposed by countries like the UK and those in EU. "PM Mikhail Mishustin and I discussed this...bearing in mind the sanctions the so-called Western community...as I called it in my speech, the 'empire of lies' - is now trying to implement against Russia," Putin said.

261.title: Don't be aggressive at railway stations: Advisory for Indians stuck in Ukraine
261.article_body: The Indian embassy in Ukraine requested Indian nationals, students stuck amid war to "remain calm, peaceful and united". Warning of large crowds at railway stations, the embassy advisory said, "It's advised that all Indian students remain patient, composed and especially not to exhibit aggressive behaviours while at the railway stations." Delays in trains and cancellations are expected, it added.

262.title: How much prize money did PSL 2022 winners get as compared to IPL 2021?
262.article_body: Pakistan Super League (PSL) 2022 winners Lahore Qalandars won a cash prize of PKR 80,000,000 (around ₹3.4 crore), while Indian Premier League 2021 champions Chennai Super Kings had won ₹20 crore. Further PSL 2022 runners-up Multan Sultans got a cash prize of PKR 32,000,000 (₹1.37 crore), while IPL 2021 runners-up KKR received a prize money of ₹12.5 crore.

263.title: 3-day Urs of Shah Jahan begins at Taj Mahal in Agra
263.article_body: The three-day Urs of Mughal emperor Shah Jahan started at the Taj Mahal in Agra on Sunday. Portals of the Taj Mahal basement housing the original graves of Shah Jahan and his consort Mumtaz Mahal were opened for visitors on the occasion. Entry to Taj Mahal was free from 2 pm on Sunday and will remain the same on Monday.

264.title: One of the most amazing experiences: Watson on playing in Pakistan
264.article_body: Terming playing in Pakistan as one of the most "amazing" experiences of his life, ex-Australia all-rounder Shane Watson said he was fortunate to play a few matches of Pakistan Premier League in the country. The 40-year-old represented Islamabad United and Quetta Gladiators in PSL. Meanwhile, Australia will be playing an all-format series in Pakistan after 24 years, beginning March 4.

265.title: TMC goons restricting my movement, can't perform duties: Cong MP
265.article_body: Congress' Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury wrote a letter to Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla over alleged incidents of violence in West Bengal municipal polls, alleging that he's unable to perform his duties as MP. Chowdhury, who is MP from Berhampore, alleged that he is often heckled and mobbed by Trinamool Congress' (TMC) "goons". "My movement is completely restricted [here]," he added.

266.title: US bans transactions with Russian central bank, National Wealth Fund
266.article_body: The United States on Monday banned its citizens and companies from carrying out transactions with the Russian central Bank, the National Wealth Fund and the Ministry of Finance. The move will immobilise any Russian central bank assets held in the US, the country's Treasury department said. The US also announced penalties on the Russian Direct Investment Fund (RDIF).

267.title: World poverty to rise as climate change hits food supplies: UN panel
267.article_body: Experts from UN's Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) on Monday warned of a rise in global poverty as climate change and extreme weather will lead to reduced food production and increased food prices, if left unchecked. The report estimated up to 183 million additional people would become undernourished in low-income countries due to climate change by 2050.

268.title: Tanzanian plane with 14 people on board crashes off Comoros
268.article_body: A Tanzania-registered light aircraft with 14 passengers and crew on board crashed into the sea off Comoros on Saturday. Rescuers in the Indian Ocean archipelago have launched a search for the missing passengers and crew, local authorities said. "As long as we have not found any bodies, there is hope," a senior police official said.

269.title: UAE's flydubai suspends flights to Russia, Ukraine and Belarus
269.article_body: United Arab Emirates airline flydubai on Monday suspended some flights to Russia, Ukraine and Belarus up to March 8. As per a notice posted on its website, the carrier banned flights to Krasnodar, Rostov-on-Don, Kiev, Odessa and Minsk. This comes after Russia launched a full-scale invasion of Ukraine on February 24 killing at least 352 civilians including 14 children.

270.title: Ukrainian singer joins army, sings on deserted Kyiv street; video goes viral
270.article_body: Ukrainian singer Andriy Khlyvnyuk has volunteered to join the army to fight the Russian troops. In a video shared by the Armed Forces of Ukraine, Khlyvnyuk could be seen dressed in military attire, holding a gun and singing a folk song on an empty street in Kyiv. Khlyvnyuk is the lead singer of the BoomBox band.

271.title: China's Long March-8 rocket launches record 22 satellites in space
271.article_body: China's Long March-8 rocket on Sunday set a new domestic record by sending 22 satellites in space in a single flight. Made by seven institutes and private companies, the satellites were deployed for commercial remote sensing services, marine environment monitoring, forest fire prevention and disaster mitigation. The rocket was launched from Wenchang Spacecraft Launch Site in Hainan province.

272.title: Delhi govt discontinues discounts on MRP of liquor, cites crowding issue
272.article_body: The Delhi government’s excise department on Monday ordered discontinuation of discounts on MRP of liquor. In its order, the department said that while the discounts were intended to promote healthy competition and consumer choice, it also led to large crowds outside stores, which can aggravate COVID-19 cases. It added that the discounting also led to unhealthy market practices.

273.title: 224 new COVID cases, 11 deaths reported in B'luru in last 24 hours
273.article_body: Bengaluru Urban has reported 224 new COVID-19 cases in the state of Karnataka in the last 24 hours. The city also recorded 326 recoveries, or people being discharged on Sunday along with 11 virus-related deaths. Bengaluru Urban district now stands at a total of 17,78,361 coronavirus cases.

274.title: Cyberabad Police to auction over 600 abandoned vehicles, list shared
274.article_body: Cyberabad Police has announced that it'll be auctioning over 600 abandoned or unclaimed vehicles of various types and make. The vehicles are currently pooled at Pahadi Shareef PS Ground, Hyderabad. The force released list of total 621 vehicles and asked people, who might've objections or ownership interest in any of the vehicles to file an application and claim the vehicle.

275.title: Can't get over Alia's brilliant performance: Basu on 'Gangubai...'
275.article_body: Taking to Twitter, filmmaker Anurag Basu wrote, "It's been three days I have seen 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' and I can't get over Alia's brilliant performance." He further added that the film's director, Sanjay Leela Bhansali, has reinstated his big screen magic again. In another tweet, Basu said that 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' is cinematographer Sudeep Chatterjee's best work to date.

276.title: G7 leaders to hold call with NATO and EU chiefs amid war in Ukraine
276.article_body: The leaders of G7 nations will hold a call with the Secretary General of NATO, EU chiefs and leaders of Romania and Poland on Monday, Italy said. Later, the European Commission President and leaders of Italy, France and Germany will hold a call, Itay added. Notably, Poland and Romania share a border with Ukraine, which has been invaded by Russia.

277.title: Dozens killed, hundreds hurt in Russian rocket strikes on Ukraine's Kharkiv
277.article_body: Dozens of people were killed in rocket strikes by Russia on the Ukrainian city of Kharkiv on Monday, Ukrainian Interior Ministry Adviser Anton Herashchenko said. Hundreds have been wounded in the strikes, Herashchenko said. This came even as peace talks between Ukraine and Russia started at the Belarusian border.

278.title: DGCA extends ban on regular commercial int'l passenger flights
278.article_body: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) on Monday extended the suspension of scheduled international commercial passenger flights to/from India till further orders. This restriction doesn't apply to international all-cargo operations, DGCA-approved flights and flights under air-bubble arrangement. The ban on scheduled international passenger flights has been in place since March 23, 2020.

279.title: My most memorable wicket was of Kohli, I knocked him over: O' Keefe
279.article_body: Australia spinner Steve O'Keefe has revealed dismissing Virat Kohli in first Test of 2017 Border-Gavaskar Trophy in Pune is his "most memorable" wicket. "I knocked him over, we were playing on this absolute dust bowl of a wicket, it was spinning...Ravi Shastri described the wicket of having dermatitis...it had holes in it," he added. O'Keefe took 12/70 in the Test.

280.title: 6th evacuation flight from Budapest with 240 Indians reaches Delhi
280.article_body: The sixth evacuation flight from Hungary's capital Budapest carrying 240 Indian nationals stranded in Ukraine landed at the Delhi airport on Monday. Union Minister Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi welcomed the Indian nationals at the airport. The Central Government has launched Operation Ganga to bring back Indians stranded in Ukraine.

281.title: Over 5 lakh have fled Ukraine since start of Russian invasion: UN
281.article_body: Over 5 lakh people have fled Ukraine since the start of Russia's invasion of the country last week, the UN refugee agency said on Monday. Of these, 2.81 lakh people have arrived in Poland, a UN spokeswoman said. Similarly, Hungary, Moldova, Romania and Slovakia have welcomed more than 84,500, about 36,400, over 32,500 and around 30,000 people from Ukraine, respectively.

282.title: Everyone wants Ranbir's response to 'Gangubai Kathiawadi': Alia
282.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt, on being asked about her boyfriend actor Ranbir Kapoor's reaction to 'Gangubai Kathiawadi', said, "Sabko Ranbir ka response chahiye (Everyone wants Ranbir's response)." The actress further said that she will try to convince Ranbir to give a byte for the movie because he is not on social media. "How can I give his response?" Alia added.

283.title: Czech Republic supports Ukraine's bid to join EU: PM Fiala
283.article_body: Czech Republic supports Ukraine's efforts to join the European Union (EU), Czech PM Petr Fiala was quoted as saying by local media on Monday. It's necessary to give a clear signal that Ukraine is welcome in the European community of democratic countries, he added. This comes amid Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's request for a fast-track membership to the bloc.

284.title: Russia closes its airspace to 36 countries including UK and Germany
284.article_body: Russia on Monday barred airlines from 36 countries including Britain, Germany, Spain, Italy and Canada from using Russian airspace. Russia's state aviation agency said that planes from these countries could only enter Russia's airspace with special permission. The move follows a decision by the EU and Canada over the weekend to close their skies to the Russian planes.

285.title: India to send humanitarian aid including medicines to Ukraine
285.article_body: India will send humanitarian aid including medicines to Ukraine, the Ministry of External Affairs spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said on Monday. This came after India abstained from voting in the UNSC for a rare special emergency session of the UN General Assembly on the Russia-Ukraine conflict. India had earlier abstained from voting on a resolution condemning Russia.

286.title: Rahul Gandhi releases Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin's autobiography
286.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday released Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin's autobiography 'Ungalil Oruvan' (One Among You) in Chennai. Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan,  Leader of Opposition in Bihar Assembly Tejashwi Yadav and National Conference leader Omar Abdullah were also present. DMK leader Duraimurugan received the first copy of the book.

287.title: 86 kg marijuana seized from 10 peddlers in 3 cases in Bengaluru
287.article_body: Police have recovered 86 kg of ganja from ten peddlers in three different cases in Bengaluru. In one of the cases, the accused reportedly confessed to procuring around 80 kg marijuana at a lower price in Andhra Pradesh and allegedly selling it in Bengaluru at about ₹40,0000-50,000. About 3.5 and 2.5 kg of ganja was recovered in other two cases.

288.title: Hyderabad student arrested for buying 40 LSD blots from dark web
288.article_body: A Hyderabad Central University student was nabbed for allegedly buying 40 LSD blots from dark web on multiple occasions. The student is among several others, including IT professionals, a doctor and other students, arrested in a major drug bust involving three separate cases on Saturday. The Hyderabad Police ended up seizing drugs including MDMA, hash oil, ganja and LSD blots.

289.title: Supertech twin towers to be destroyed by May 22: Noida authority
289.article_body: Noida authority on Monday informed the Supreme Court that Supertech's twin 40-storey towers in its Emerald Court project will be demolished by May 22. The work on the demolition has already started, it said. The SC, on August 31, 2021, announced the demolition of the twin towers within three months for violation of building norms in "collusion with Noida officials."

290.title: Eaten only 3-4 spoons of rice in a day, we need help: Indian student in Ukraine
290.article_body: Speaking about her ordeal while being stuck in Ukraine, an Indian student said that she along with a few more students have eaten only three to four spoons of rice a day. She added, "We are roaming on the road and can meet with any fate. We need help." Another student has alleged harassment of female students by Ukrainian guards.

291.title: Hong Kong logs record over 34,000 new COVID-19 cases in last 24 hours
291.article_body: Hong Kong authorities on Monday reported 34,466 new COVID-19 cases in last 24 hours, increasing by four times from a week ago. "Once every three days the case number will double," said Albert Au, Principal Medical and Health Officer. On the other hand, Hong Kong Health Minister Sophia Chan said the government was "still discussing" the matter of lockdown.

292.title: Dera chief Ram Rahim brought back to jail after end of furlough
292.article_body: Dera Sacha Sauda chief Gurmeet Ram Rahim Singh was brought back to Rohtak's Sunaria jail after the end of his 21-day furlough on Monday. He was granted the furlough to meet his family. Ram Rahim is serving a life term for the murder of his manager in 2002 and was also convicted for the rape of two women in 2017.

293.title: Qatar calls for diplomatic settlement between Ukraine and Russia
293.article_body: Qatar Foreign Minister Sheikh Mohammed bin Abdulrahman Al-Thani called for a diplomatic settlement between Ukraine, Russia. In a speech at Human Rights Council in Geneva, Al-Thani backed a settlement which will preserve Ukraine's sovereignty, territorial integrity within its recognised boundaries. This comes as Russia launched an invasion of Ukraine on February 24 killing at least 352 people.

294.title: Inappropriate to compare Ukraine’s situation with ours: Taiwan
294.article_body: Taiwanese government said on Monday that it’s inappropriate for people to compare Ukraine’s situation with theirs. Taiwan has a natural barrier (Taiwan Strait) that separates it from China, Cabinet spokesperson Lo Ping-cheng said. These remarks come after UK PM Boris Johnson said that Western indifference to Russian aggression in Ukraine could lead to threat to Taiwan.

295.title: Sushant's death a tough test for my relationship with Ankita: Vicky
295.article_body: Actress Ankita Lokhande's husband Vicky Jain has said that the death of actor Sushant Singh Rajput was a tough test for their relationship. Ankita and Sushant were in a relationship for six years before breaking up in 2016. Vicky further said that he was proud of how Ankita handled herself after Sushant's death, adding that she fulfilled her responsibility.

296.title: 71% jump in PSL 2022 profits, most in its history: Ramiz Raja
296.article_body: Pakistan Cricket Board Chairman Ramiz Raja said Pakistan Super League 2022 has witnessed a jump of 71% in profits, which is the most in the tournament's history. He added every franchise earned PKR 900 million (over $5 million), all before the first ball was even bowled. Lahore Qalandars defeated Multan Sultans by 42 runs to win their maiden PSL trophy.

297.title: Credit growth to industry rises to 6.4% in Jan 2022 from 0.7% in Jan 2021
297.article_body: Reserve Bank of India's data showed that India's credit growth to industry rose from 0.7% in January 2021 to 6.4% in January 2022. Credit growth to medium enterprises is pegged at 74.7% against 21.8% in January 2021. Credit growth to micro and small industries accelerated to 19.7% from 0.5% and credit to large industries rose to 0.5% against -0.2%.

298.title: Journey from Ukraine was hassle-free: B'luru students on return
298.article_body: Indians who returned to Bengaluru from Ukraine said they had a hassle-free journey due to efforts of Indian Embassy officials in Ukraine as well as in Hungary and Slovakia. A batch of 12 students from Karnataka has landed at the Bengaluru airport on Sunday. MEA Spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said as of now, six flights have arrived carrying around 1,400 Indians.

299.title: Even if you win Ballon d'Or 7 times, you've to adapt: Mbappe on Messi
299.article_body: Talking about Lionel Messi, Paris Saint-Germain forward Kylian Mbappe said, "I'm happy for him because we know he's adjusting to a new life, a new city and a new club." He added, "Even when you win Ballon d'Or seven times, you have to adapt too." Kylian opined that Messi is "getting better and better" at the club.

300.title: Adapting to Pak conditions will be challenge for Australia: Watson
300.article_body: Former Australia all-rounder Shane Watson has said that he is "super excited" for the Australia tour of Pakistan. This is Australia's first tour of Pakistan since 1998. "I think it is going to be an exceptional challenge for the Australian team to try and adapt to the Pakistan conditions when they haven't been there for so long," Watson stated.

301.title: Go to West Ukraine but don't go directly to border: India to Indians in Ukraine
301.article_body: Ministry of External Affairs has advised Indians stuck in Ukraine to go to West Ukraine but not go directly to the borders. "There's rush there (at the borders), it'll take time. Go to nearby cities, seek shelter there," said MEA spokesperson Arindam Bagchi. "We're making arrangements there, our teams will help you. Don't panic, we have enough flights," he added.

302.title: Ukrainian man moves landmine with bare hands while smoking a cigarette
302.article_body: A video of a Ukrainian man moving a landmine with his bare hands while smoking a cigarette has gone viral on social media. Media outlet The New Voice of Ukraine tweeted, "A Ukrainian spotted a mine on the road...and didn't wait around for a bomb disposal unit." It added, "At great risk to life and limb, he removed the mine."

303.title: US closes embassy in Belarus, allows non-essential staff to leave Russia
303.article_body: The United States on Monday suspended operations at its Belarus embassy and allowed the non-essential staff and their families at the US Embassy in Russia to leave the country amid the situation in Ukraine. "We took these steps due to security and safety issues stemming from the unprovoked...attack by Russian military forces in Ukraine," said Secretary of State Antony Blinken.

304.title: Govt's fiscal deficit rises to 59% of FY22 target in Apr 2021-Jan 2022
304.article_body: The Centre's fiscal deficit rose to 58.9% of its FY22 target between April 2021 and January 2022, data by the Controller General of Accounts showed. In Budget 2021, the government had aimed for a fiscal deficit of 6.8% of the GDP in FY22. Centre's capital expenditure in April 2021-January 2022 recorded a 22% YoY rise to ₹4.42 lakh crore.

305.title: Woman loses ₹3.25 lakh in cyber fraud in Noida
305.article_body: A woman from Noida lost ₹3.25 lakh after a cyber fraudster stole her bank account details on the pretext of updating the know your customer (KYC) details of her phone number. The fraudster had asked the victim to pay ₹10 online to reactivate her phone services. Subsequently, the money was withdrawn from the victim's bank account.

306.title: Biocon Biologics acquires Viatris' biosimilars assets in ₹25,169 cr deal
306.article_body: India's largest biopharmaceutical firm Biocon Biologics Ltd (BBL) signed a pact with Viatris to acquire the latter's biosimilars business for up to $3.34 billion (₹25,169 crore) in cash and stock. Viatris will receive $2 billion (₹15,071 crore) in cash on closing of the transaction and up to $335 million (₹2,524 crore) as additional payments expected to be paid in 2024.

307.title: Too early to do that: Rajkumar on India looking beyond Kohli, Rohit in T20Is
307.article_body: Disagreeing with a suggestion of replacing Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma in T20Is, Kohli's childhood coach Rajkumar Sharma said, "It's too early to do that." He added, "Rohit is a master player in T20s. On his day, he can single-handedly win games for the team...don't think wholesale changes are needed." Notably, India is on a 12-match winning streak in T20Is.

308.title: MLA Raja Bhaiya booked for thrashing SP worker amid UP elections
308.article_body: Kunda MLA Raghuraj Pratap Singh, also known as Raja Bhaiya, has been booked for thrashing a polling agent of the SP ahead of the sixth phase of the Uttar Pradesh elections. An FIR has been filed against Raja Bhaiya and 17 others at the Kunda police station. Provisions of the SC/ST Act and IPC sections have been invoked.

309.title: 5 khadi shops gutted as fire breaks out in Dalhousie market
309.article_body: Five khadi shops were burnt to ashes after a fire broke out at the Gandhi Chowk Market in Himachal Pradesh's Dalhousie on Monday. SDM Jagan Thakur said the cause of fire is being ascertained. Fire tenders were rushed to the spot and the blaze was brought under control in two hours. No loss of life was reported in the mishap.

310.title: Noida Police arrest 26-yr-old man for killing friend
310.article_body: Noida Police on Sunday arrested 26-year-old Chandra Bhan for killing his friend Sanjeev Kumar, who shared a rented accommodation with him in Noida's Phase 2. The police said that Kumar was in an illicit relationship with Bhan's wife. When Bhan came to know about the affair, he strangled Kumar and fled with his wife, the police added.

311.title: Former acting DGP Sanjay Pandey appointed new Mumbai Police chief
311.article_body: The Maharashtra government has appointed former Maharashtra acting Director General of Police Sanjay Pandey as the new Mumbai Police Commissioner. He has replaced Hemant Nagrale, who was given the post after Param Bir Singh was shunted as the Mumbai Police chief. Nagrale will now be the Managing Director of the Maharashtra State Security Corporation.

312.title: Ukraine shares video of drone strikes on Russian convoy, says 'Fear, enemies!'
312.article_body: The Ukrainian air force carried out two drone strikes on a Russian convoy of more than a dozen vehicles using Turkish-made Bayraktar TB2 drones. Footage of the strike was also released on social media. Sharing the video on Twitter, the Armed Forces of Ukraine wrote, "Fear, enemies! There will be no peace for you on our earth!"

313.title: India's GDP growth slows to 5.4% in Q3 of FY22 compared to 8.4% in Q2
313.article_body: India's GDP growth slowed down to 5.4% during the third quarter of 2021-2022 compared to 8.4% in the previous quarter, the Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation said on Monday. It also estimated that India's GDP will likely grow by 8.9% in 2021-22. In its first advanced estimate, the government had estimated the GDP in 2021-22 to grow by 9.2%.

314.title: Former Rajya Sabha MP Yadlapati Venkata Rao passes away at 102
314.article_body: Former Rajya Sabha MP and veteran Telugu Desam Party (TDP) leader Yadlapati Venkata Rao passed away at the age of 102 in Hyderabad on Monday. Rao, who was nominated to the Rajya Sabha in 1998, had previously served as Agriculture Minister in undivided Andhra Pradesh in the late 1970s. Rao was affiliated with Congress before he joined TDP in 1983.

315.title: Delhi man harasses colleague by making fake accounts, arrested
315.article_body: The Delhi Police's cyber cell on Sunday arrested a man for harassing and stalking his colleague by creating fake social media accounts in her name to send defamatory messages to her family and friends. The accused disclosed that he was in a relationship with the woman for the last 10 years, but later the woman started ignoring him, police said.

316.title: Around 1,400 Indians brought back to India from Ukraine on 6 flights: Govt
316.article_body: As many as 1,396 Indians have been brought back to India from Ukraine in six flights, the government said on Monday. Four flights have arrived from Bucharest (Romania) and two flights from Budapest (Hungary), Ministry of External Affairs spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said. Around 8,000 Indians have left Ukraine since the current conflict with Russia began, he said.

317.title: Development of UP is my responsibility & priority: PM Modi in Ballia
317.article_body: Addressing a rally in poll-bound UP's Ballia on Monday, PM Modi said that development of the state is his "responsibility and priority". "I have an emotional connect with Ballia as...scheme to provide free gas cylinders Ujjwala was launched from here," PM added. Ballia will vote in the sixth phase of UP Assembly elections, which will be held on March 3.

318.title: Airbnb to house up to 1 lakh Ukrainian refugees for free, says CEO
318.article_body: Airbnb will provide free short-term housing for up to 1 lakh refugees fleeing Ukraine amid Russian invasion, the startup's CEO Brian Chesky announced on Twitter. Airbnb's senior executives have written to the governments of Poland, Romania, Germany and Hungary offering their support for housing refugees. The housing will be funded by Airbnb, donors and hosts on the platform, Chesky said.

319.title: Kazakh firm blocks Russian TV stations over Russia-Ukraine war
319.article_body: Kazakhstan's Remstroyservice company on Monday blocked Russian TV stations over their coverage of Russian invasion of Ukraine. "We are against war and against war propaganda," said Shakhtinsk-based company. Remstroyservice added they are running Kazakh state TV instead of all major Russian stations. This comes after at least 352 people were killed after Russia invaded Ukraine on February 24.

320.title: Satellite pic shows 5-km long convoy of Russian troops deployed near Kyiv
320.article_body: A satellite picture released by Maxar Technologies showed an over 5-km long convoy of Russian troops comprising hundreds of military vehicles deployed near the Ukrainian capital Kyiv. The convoy contained fuel, logistics and armoured vehicles including tanks, infantry fighting vehicles and self-propelled artillery, Maxar Technologies said. Russia-Ukraine war entered its fifth day today.

321.title: Google Maps stops showing Ukraine's live traffic worldwide temporarily
321.article_body: Google has globally disabled the Google Maps traffic layer and live information on how busy places like stores and restaurants are in Ukraine. Google said the decision was taken for the safety of local communities in the country, after consulting with sources including regional authorities. Live traffic information remains available to drivers using its turn-by-turn navigation features in Ukraine.

322.title: Carry enough cash, ready to eat meals: Indian embassy to students in Ukraine
322.article_body: The Indian embassy in Ukraine has released a second advisory for its nationals stranded in the country amid the Russian invasion. Referring to the students, it asked them to carry their passports, enough cash, ready to eat meals and winter clothing. The embassy also appreciated the Ukrainian authorities for supporting the evacuation of Indian citizens during these "dangerous times".

323.title: Headmistress of DPS Faridabad arrested in student's suicide case
323.article_body: Faridabad Police on Sunday arrested the headmistress of Delhi Public School, Faridabad on the charge of abetment of suicide, days after a class 10 student died by suicide after allegedly being harassed over his sexuality. Police said that a note was recovered on Friday, in which the 16-year-old allegedly blamed the school and "higher authorities."

324.title: Amul increases price for milk across India by ₹2 per litre
324.article_body: Amul is increasing the price for its milk across India by ₹2 per litre. The increased price of Amul milk will be applicable from tomorrow, March 1. Amul said that it is increasing the price of milk due to an increase in the prices of energy, packaging, transportation cost and animal feed.

325.title: Probe war crimes in Ukraine: Lithuania to International Criminal Court
325.article_body: Lithuanian government announced on Monday that it will ask prosecutors in International Criminal Court to investigate war crimes in Ukraine due to Russian military offensive. "There's new material coming in every day, but we have enough of it by now to file...request," Lithuanian PM Ingrida Šimonytė said. At least 102 Ukrainian civilians have been killed since Russian invasion, UN said.

326.title: Mumbai man beats wife to death, tries to stage it as accident
326.article_body: A 27-year-old man in Mumbai's Dharavi, who beat his 22-year-old wife to death last week before trying to stage the crime as an accident, has been charged with her murder. The accused, Rahul Jaiswal, told doctors that she had fallen from the mezzanine floor and fell unconscious. However, a post-mortem reportedly led to the revelation that she had been killed.

327.title: Harshal is getting better and better since the IPL 2021: Zaheer
327.article_body: Ex-India fast bowler Zaheer Khan said Harshal Patel is "getting better and better" since the IPL 2021. "Harshal has played all the games...with consistency as well," he added. Harshal had won the Purple Cap in IPL 2021 after taking 32 wickets. In the recently concluded T20I series against West Indies and Sri Lanka, Harshal scalped five and two wickets, respectively.

328.title: I move on quick: Shreyas after his 3 half-centuries in SL T20I series
328.article_body: Talking about his current form, India batter Shreyas Iyer, who was adjudged 'Player of the Series' in T20I series against Sri Lanka, said he tries to move on quickly as people tend to forget the past performances. Shreyas scored three half-centuries (57*, 74*, 73*) in the series. Shreyas had scored 105 on his Test debut in Kanpur in November 2021.

329.title: BMC to install new bus shelters at 105 places in Mumbai suburbs
329.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) will be replacing existing bus shelters with new ones at 105 locations in Mumbai's eastern and western suburbs as part of its Tactical Urbanism plan. The project aims to maximise use of public spaces to make them available for citizens. The new shelters will have transparent enclosures and movable metal benches clamped on the footpath.

330.title: Lufthansa cancels 30 flights to Russia amid Russia-Ukraine war
330.article_body: German flag airline, Lufthansa on Monday said they cancelled 30 flights of Lufthansa, Eurowings and Austrian Airlines carriers to Russia this week. This comes after the country on Saturday said it was preparing to shut its airspace to Russian planes. At least 352 people including 14 children were killed after Russia launched a full-scale invasion of Ukraine on February 24.

331.title: 800 protesters arrested in Belarus amid vote on non-nuclear status
331.article_body: Around 800 people have been arrested in Belarus as the country voted to revoke its non-nuclear status through a constitutional referendum vote, the Belarusian government said on Monday. Protesters had taken to the streets across Belarus and chanted anti-war slogans amid the Russian invasion of Ukraine. Belarus' vote came after Russia put its nuclear deterrent forces on high alert.

332.title: Mumbai-Navi Mumbai water taxi runs only 3 trips in 10 days
332.article_body: The first-ever water taxi service between Mumbai and Navi Mumbai has run only three trips in 10 days after inauguration on February 17. The CEO of Maharashtra Maritime Board, the nodal agency for the project, said a meeting will be held with all stakeholders to find a solution on March 2. A one-way ticket is priced between ₹800 to ₹1,200.

333.title: India's fourth COVID-19 wave may begin around June 22: IIT Kanpur study
333.article_body: The fourth wave of COVID-19 in India may start around June 22 and may peak from mid to late August, a modelling study by researchers at the IIT-Kanpur has indicated. The researchers, however, noted that a possible new variant of coronavirus may impact the whole analysis. The impact will depend on the possible variant's infectibility, fatality, etc, they said.

334.title: EU acting hostile, weapon supplies to Ukraine dangerous: Russia
334.article_body: Russia on Monday accused the European Union of acting hostile towards it and warned against the supply of weapons to Ukraine. "EU is acting in a hostile fashion towards us. Weapons' supplies to Ukraine are dangerous and destabilising," said Russia. This comes after the EU promised to finance the purchase and delivery of weapons and equipment to Ukraine.

335.title: Roman-era tombs from 1st century AD found at Gaza construction site
335.article_body: Construction workers unearthed Roman-era tombs from 2,000 years ago at a construction site in Beit Lahia, Gaza. Confirming the discovery, Naji Sarhan, spokesperson of Gaza's Ministry of Public Works said there are other graves at site. While construction has been halted at the site, experts from Gaza's Ministry of Antiquities and Tourism have been sent to inspect gravestones and artefacts.

336.title: Hong Kong mortuaries run out of space as COVID-19 deaths mount
336.article_body: The mortuaries in Hong Kong ran out of space to store bodies amid a surge in COVID-19 fatalities. According to Tony Ling, head of the city's Public Doctors Association, dozens of bodies are lying at hospitals waiting to be transported to mortuaries. "These bodies now need extra time to wait for collection because resources are just so tight," said Ling.

337.title: It'll be made, it's a dream: Bhushan on Gulshan Kumar biopic with Aamir
337.article_body: T-Series MD Bhushan Kumar said that 'Mogul', a film based on the life of his father and the company's founder Gulshan Kumar, will happen for sure. The biopic will feature Aamir Khan as Gulshan. "It'll be...little later...because Aamir sir's film (Laal Singh Chaddha) has been delayed...I'm in no hurry to make [it]...It's not...project for me, it's a dream," Bhushan said.

338.title: What a blast we had shooting: Shilpa Shetty on 25 yrs of 'Auzaar'
338.article_body: As film 'Auzaar' completed 25 years, actress Shilpa Shetty Kundra recalled working on the project. Taking to Instagram, Shilpa posted a video, which features a few scenes from the movie. She captioned it, "Working with friends never quite felt like work even back then. What a blast we had shooting #Auzaar...with such fabulous co-stars like @beingsalmankhan @sanjaykapoor2500."

339.title: Ukraine demands immediate ceasefire, withdrawal of Russian troops
339.article_body: Ukraine on Monday demanded an immediate ceasefire and withdrawal of the Russian troops from its territories. This comes as a Ukrainian delegation reached Belarusian town of Gomel to hold talks with the Russian counterpart. "The Ukrainian delegation arrived at the Ukrainian-Belarusian border to take part in talks with representatives of the Russian Federation," the Ukrainian presidency said.

340.title: Scientists reveal 4.4 million galaxies via radio telescope
340.article_body: A team of international scientists revealed an "astonishingly detailed" radio image of 4.4 million galaxies through Low Frequency Array (LOFAR), a pan-European radio telescope. The team used algorithms on high-performance computers across Europe to process observations lasting 3,500 hours. This release is only 27 per cent of the entire survey, said Timothy Shimwell of Leiden University.

341.title: Govt revises travel guidelines for Indians being evacuated from Ukraine
341.article_body: The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare (MoHFW) on Monday revised its international travel advisory, providing certain exemptions to Indians being evacuated from war-hit Ukraine. Mandatory pre-boarding negative RT-PCR test report or full vaccination certificate have been exempted for Indians. Indians have also been exempted from uploading these documents on Air Suvidha portal before departure.

342.title: Salman threw his diary at me when I asked for 'Har Dil Jo...' dates: Sajid
342.article_body: Film producer Sajid Nadiadwala said he and actor Salman Khan got into an argument over dates for the film 'Har Dil Jo Pyar Karega'. Sajid said he told Salman the shooting was to begin in 20 days. "He threw his diary at me...I took diary and adjusted his dates. I cancelled few of his scheduled dates, added mine," he added.

343.title: A movie that slapped patriarchy: Taapsee on two years of 'Thappad'
343.article_body: As film 'Thappad' completed two years, actress Taapsee Pannu shared a post for the film. Sharing a video compilation of several glimpses from the film, Taapsee captioned it, "Celebrating two years of @anubhavsinhaa's Thappad, the movie that confidently called out the flawed societal norms and slapped patriarchy!" Actress Dia Mirza also shared the same video on her Instagram handle.

344.title: Shibani gets wedding date with Farhan tattooed, shares pics
344.article_body: Actress Shibani Dandekar has gotten her wedding date with actor-filmmaker Farhan Akhtar tattooed on the back of her left forearm in Roman numerals which reads XXI.II.XXII. The couple got married on February 19 at a private ceremony in Khandala. Shibani had gotten Farhan's name tattooed on her neck as a birthday gift to him last year.

345.title: Diljit, Arjun Rampal to star in Honey's film based on true events: Reports
345.article_body: Diljit Dosanjh and Arjun Rampal will reportedly share screen space in an upcoming film, which will be helmed by 'Raat Akeli Hai' director Honey Trehan. According to reports, Diljit will play an activist who'll fight for the victims of the 1984 anti-Sikh riots. It's being jointly produced by Ronnie Screwvala, Honey and Abhishek Chaubey, as per reports.

346.title: Major fire breaks out in Mumbai's Kanjurmarg area, no casualty reported
346.article_body: A "level-2 (major) fire" broke out on Monday afternoon in the NG Royal Park residential building located in Mumbai's Kanjurmarg (East), a fire official said. The fire was confined to the ninth and tenth floors of the building and there was no report of any casualty, the official added. Six fire engines, four jumbo tankers were rushed to the spot.

347.title: India's priority is to evacuate students, our priority is to stop war: Ukraine envoy
347.article_body: India's priority is to evacuate students, our priority is to stop the war and exert pressure on Russia, said Ukraine's Ambassador to India Igor Polikha. He added, "We are requesting all our foreign partners to exert pressure on Russian President Vladimir Putin to stop the war." The government is sending four Union Ministers to Ukraine's neighbouring countries to coordinate evacuation.

348.title: Mamata offers unconditional support to PM on Ukraine crisis, seeks all-party meet
348.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has written to PM Narendra Modi, offering her "unconditional support" amid the Russia-Ukraine crisis. Mamata also requested him to consider convening an all-party meeting. "In times of grave international crisis we keep aside our domestic disagreements to stand united as a nation...India must take lead to offer a peaceful solution to the world," she wrote.
