349.title: Thought we'd be saved just like in movies, doesn't seem so now: Indian in Ukraine
349.article_body: Indian student Garima Mishra from UP appealed for help from the Indian government while being stranded amidst war in Ukraine, saying, "We used to see this in movies. We thought we would be saved." She added, "But now it doesn't seem like we will be saved...Please send someone by air to help us. Send the Indian Army."

350.title: Business with Russia means financing Hitler of 21st century: Ukraine Foreign Minister
350.article_body: Ukraine Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba took to Twitter to urge countries to cut all business ties with Russia. He wrote, "Making business with Russia today means financing aggression, war crimes, disinformation, cyberattacks and personally the Hitler of the 21st century named Vladimir Putin." The Ukraine-Russia war entered its fifth day today.

351.title: Dynasts can never make India capable: PM Narendra Modi
351.article_body: PM Narendra Modi said dynasts can never make India capable. "Dynasts can never make India capable, they can never make UP capable. Can these dynasts do anything?" PM Modi added. "During the COVID-19 period, they left no stone unturned to hurt the confidence of India. They tried to instigate the poor of the country against the indigenous vaccines," he stated.

352.title: Harshal bowling too many slower balls, Unadkat did the same: Rajkumar Sharma
352.article_body: Virat Kohli's childhood coach Rajkumar Sharma has said India pacer Harshal Patel is bowling too many slower balls and needs to vary his deliveries. "Jaydev Unadkat was also doing the same, which made him predictable...Harshal needs to mix it up. He bowls the slower one really well," Rajkumar added. Harshal conceded 52 runs in the second Sri Lanka T20I.

353.title: Wrestler Ravi Dahiya wins gold at Yasar Dogu Ranking Series
353.article_body: Tokyo Olympics silver medallist wrestler Ravi Dahiya defeated Uzbekistan's Gulomjon Abdullaev 11-10 in the 61kg final to win gold in Yasar Dogu Ranking Series in Istanbul. Dahiya was trailing 8-10, but stood better in his last move in the final. Dahiya, who won the Olympics silver in men's freestyle 57kg, had lost to Abdullaev in Poland last year.

354.title: Ukrainian children appeal for help in video, say 'We are afraid, we want to live'
354.article_body: Ukraine's Centre for Strategic Communications and Information Security took to Twitter to share a video of children appealing to foreigners to save their lives in a video amid war with Russia. In the video, the children say that they are afraid and want to live. Russia's attack on Ukraine reached its fifth day today.

355.title: Ukraine man partially sinks Russian boss' ₹59-cr yacht, says 'No regrets' after arrest
355.article_body: A Ukrainian sailor in Spain was arrested after he partially sank his Russian boss' luxury yacht worth €7 million (around ₹59 crore). While he was later released, he said he didn’t regret his actions as his boss was a "criminal who sells weapons that kill the Ukrainian people". His boss had taken over a Russian state-owned weapons supplier in 2016.

356.title: Who is Madhabi Puri Buch, the first-ever woman to head SEBI?
356.article_body: Madhabi Puri Buch has been appointed as the first-ever woman Chairperson of SEBI. She was not only SEBI's first woman whole-time member but also the first person working at SEBI from the private sector. An IIM Ahmedabad alumna, Buch started her career with ICICI Bank, joined Greater Pacific Capital in Singapore and also served at New Development Bank in Shanghai.

357.title: Yami shares pics with kids from 'A Thursday', calls them 'cutest co-actors'
357.article_body: Actress Yami Gautam took to Instagram to share pictures with her children co-actors from the film 'A Thursday'. "Cutest co-actors I ever got to work with...Stepping in Naina's shoes was way more challenging than I had imagined while preparing for the part...But somewhere these little kids came in as a breather," she wrote.

358.title: Rohit is in the XI because of his batting, shouldn't lose focus: Saba
358.article_body: Former India wicketkeeper Saba Karim has said that Rohit Sharma shouldn't lose focus with the bat after being named Team India captain in all formats. "Rohit is in the XI because of his batting. Captaincy is an additional responsibility," he stated. "Lot of times we've seen...captains are not able to perform as well in their primary skill," he added.

359.title: Samantha shares article praising Ukraine President's courage amid invasion
359.article_body: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu on Monday took to Instagram to share an article praising Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's courage amid the Russian invasion. The article is titled 'A Prayer for Volodymyr Zelensky' and the excerpt read, "History has found the Ukrainian President and his courage is remarkable to witness." Several pictures of the Russian invasion have surfaced on social media.

360.title: Vidyut to host a show on martial arts, titled 'India's Ultimate Warrior'
360.article_body: Actor Vidyut Jammwal is set to host a reality show exploring martial arts and combat skills, titled 'India's Ultimate Warrior'. The actor, who is trained in Kalaripayattu, an ancient martial art form that originated in Kerala, will find the "ultimate warrior, who has the right blend of physical and mental attributes like focus, control, determination, balance and discipline".

361.title: Virat Kohli should be opening the innings with Rohit Sharma: Hogg
361.article_body: Former Australia spinner Brad Hogg said Virat Kohli should open the innings along with skipper Rohit Sharma for India in the T20Is. "For me, if you're going to have Kohli in the team, he should be opening the batting with Rohit," Hogg stated. As an opener, Kohli has played eight T20I matches for India and has scored 278 runs.

362.title: 64-year-old Delhi man arrested for cheating 60 people of over ₹14 crore
362.article_body: A 64-year-old man has been arrested in Delhi for allegedly cheating over 60 people, including government and public sector employees, of over ₹14 crore by assuring them possession of a flat in a housing project in Greater Noida, police said. The accused, one of the directors of Shubhkamna Buildtech Pvt Ltd, had promised to deliver the project by 2013.

363.title: If Salman hates someone, the person will get to know: Pooja Hegde
363.article_body: Speaking about working with Salman Khan in 'Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali', actress Pooja Hegde said he's a "real person". "He's very sweet...So it's...easy to communicate with someone like that," she added. "What I love about him is that if he loves you...he really does, you can tell that. And if he hates you, you can tell that too," Pooja said.

364.title: Opp'n tried to promote vaccine hesitancy by creating doubts: PM Modi
364.article_body: Opposition tried to promote vaccine hesitancy by creating doubts in the poor people's minds, said Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday. "Those Indians who felt proud by knowing that vaccines were Made in India were incited by the Opposition not to take the doses," PM Modi added. "Even the big countries...are far behind India in vaccination coverage today," he added.

365.title: Marathi actress reveals ATM details to cyber fraudsters, loses ₹1.48 lakh
365.article_body: A 64-year-old Marathi actress was cheated of ₹1.48 lakh after a text message from her telecom operator allegedly asked her to update her know your customer (KYC) details and added that her number will be blocked if she failed to do so. It asked her to reveal her ATM card details after which money from her bank account was withdrawn.

366.title: If they think I'll let down audience, I won't take money: Ronit on TV return
366.article_body: While talking about how one can convince him for a show, Actor Ronit Roy, who will be seen in show 'Swaran Ghar' said he looks for the story, if he finds it interesting and what is his part in the story. "But if they think I'm going to let down my audience, then I won't take the money," he added.

367.title: Bulgarian Defence Minister to be sacked for not calling Russian invasion a war
367.article_body: Bulgaria's Prime Minister Kiril Petkov has said he would sack Defence Minister Stefan Yanev for terming the Russian invasion of Ukraine as an operation and not war. "My Defence Minister cannot use the word 'operation' instead of 'war'. You cannot call it an operation when thousands of soldiers from the one and the other side are already killed," Petkov said.

368.title: Cong's Mekedatu padayatra is for political gains: K'taka CM
368.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Monday said Congress' Mekedatu padayatra (foot march) demanding the implementation of the Mekedatu project across the Cauvery River is for political gains. Congress failed to even make Mekedatu's Detailed Project Report when they were in power, Bommai said. Congress resumed the padayatra on Sunday after temporarily stopping it in January amid rising COVID-19 cases.

369.title: BJP only party to confidently say we did what we promised: Nadda
369.article_body: BJP is the only party that can confidently say we did what we promised, JP Nadda, BJP chief said on Monday. "Earlier, children of poor (people) used to study under a lantern but now they are studying under full bright light as we have given 24 hours electricity," Nadda added while addressing a rally in Machhali Shahar, Jaunpur.

370.title: When I saw Bumrah, I wondered how he could bowl fast with his action: Shami
370.article_body: Talking about his relationship with pacer Jasprit Bumrah, Mohammad Shami recalled when he first saw the 28-year-old in the IPL. "It felt a bit strange seeing him because of his bowling action. I wondered how someone could bowl so fast with that action and where he got the power from," stated Shami, adding that Bumrah has "everything" in his bowling.

371.title: Man arrested for selling fake branded clothes in Hyderabad
371.article_body: A man accused of selling counterfeit versions of branded clothes in Hyderabad was arrested by Rachakonda Police on Saturday. The accused, identified as Sandi Satyapal Reddy, was nabbed by Special Operations Team (SOT) in LB Nagar zone. Fake garments worth over ₹2 lakh of brands including Louis Philippe and Allen Solly were also recovered from the accused's possession, police added.

372.title: War doesn't take sides, it causes loss of lives: Iulia on Russia-Ukraine crisis
372.article_body: Actor-model Iulia Vantur took to Instagram Stories to react to the Russia-Ukraine crisis. She wrote, "War does not take sides. It only causes loss of life and suffering." "My heart goes out to innocent lives lost in this war. The only side I am on is that may humanity choose peace against every option possible," she further wrote.

373.title: 'Shri Akhand Path Sahib' recited at Delhi gurdwara for well being of Indians in Ukraine
373.article_body: The Delhi Sikh Gurdwara Management Committee (DSGMC) organised a 'Shri Akhand Path Sahib' (recital) of Guru Granth Sahib at Gurdwara Bangla Sahib for the well being of Indians stranded in Ukraine. "Government should ensure that our citizens don't face any problem there and they should be brought to India soon," Atma Singh Lubana, Vice President, DSGMC said.

374.title: Pune woman going to office killed after being hit by speeding vehicle
374.article_body: A 24-year-old woman riding a motorcycle was killed after being hit by a speeding vehicle in Pune's Bavdhan, police said. The woman, a resident of Sinhagad Road, was going to her office in Baner on February 25 when the incident took place. She had received major injuries, leading to her death, police added.

375.title: Man out on interim bail in murder case killed in South Delhi
375.article_body: A 28-year-old man, who was out of jail on an interim bail after being involved in a murder case, was shot dead by unidentified assailants in South Delhi on Monday. The deceased, Shivam Pandey, was lodged in the Tihar jail from 2016 to 2020. Police said they got call at 3 am about firing and that several bullets were fired.

376.title: Hrithik & Tiger don't stop practising until they've perfected a step: Dharmesh
376.article_body: Choreographer Dharmesh Yelande has said he really likes Hrithik Roshan and Tiger Shroff in terms of acting and dancing. "I've worked with them, and I've witnessed how particular they're about everything they do. They don't stop practising a particular step until it's perfect," he added. "Be it a hard step or an easy one, they perform everything with...perfection," said Dharmesh.

377.title: Don't want to give details on my wedding, it's nobody's business: Alia
377.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt, who's reportedly in a relationship with actor Ranbir Kapoor, said that she likes to keep her private life guarded. "I don't want to give out details of when I'm getting married because it's nobody's business," she added. "But people are speculating and talking about it, now that there is something I can't do much about," Alia said.

378.title: No plans to play Spider-Man again, but no one believes me: Andrew
378.article_body: Actor Andrew Garfield, on being asked if he will portray Spider-Man again, said that there are no plans and "that's the truth". The actor further said, "Everyone's going to call me a liar for the rest of my life. I am the boy who cried wolf now." Andrew had earlier denied his appearance in Tom Holland-starrer 'Spider-Man: No Way Home'.

379.title: I just want to see one left-arm bowler in Indian squad for T20 WC: Irfan
379.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Irfan Pathan has said that he wants to see one left-arm fast bowler in the Indian squad for the upcoming T20 World Cup. "A left-arm bowler and that can be whoever performs in the IPL, Khaleel Ahmed, T Natarajan or Chetan Sakariya...Left is always right," he stated. ICC men's 2022 T20 World Cup will take place in October-November.

380.title: Ukrainians block movement of Russian tanks that stopped to seek directions
380.article_body: Hundreds of unarmed Ukrainian locals surrounded Russian tanks on the outskirts of Koryukivka in Ukraine after the Russian soldiers stopped to ask for directions on Monday. Videos of the incident showed Ukrainian men and women standing in front of the tanks and blocking their movement. A Ukrainian man was earlier filmed trying to block a Russian tank convoy.

381.title: What are the features of 'Mriya', world's largest plane destroyed by Russia in Ukraine?
381.article_body: Ukraine has said that the world's largest plane, Antonov An-225 'Mriya', was destroyed by Russian occupants on an airfield near Kyiv on Sunday. 'Mriya', which means "dream" in Ukrainian, is powered by six turbofan engines, has a wingspan of 290 feet, and a maximum payload weight of 2,50,000 kg. Only one An-225 was ever built by the Kiev-based Antonov company.

382.title: Those who troll on religion are not real Indians: Mohammad Shami
382.article_body: Talking about getting trolled after Pakistan's victory against India in T20 World Cup 2021, pacer Mohammad Shami said, "Those who troll on religion aren't real fans...nor are they real Indians." He added, "If you consider a player as hero and then behave this way...you aren't being an Indian supporter....I feel one shouldn't get hurt by comments made by such people."

383.title: I was advised to get breast implants at 18: Deepika Padukone
383.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone has revealed that the worst advice she ever received was to get breast implants. "I was all of 18 and I often wonder how I had the wisdom to not take it seriously," the actress said. Deepika had recounted this in an earlier interview as well, saying she was told it was the way to get recognised.

384.title: Ukrainian public figures targeted by 'Ghostwriter' hacking group: Meta
384.article_body: The social media accounts of a handful of Ukrainian public figures, including military officials and politicians, were compromised by a hacking group known as 'Ghostwriter', Meta said. The hackers attempted to post videos portraying Ukrainian troops as weakened. It added that it had separately disabled a network of fake accounts, groups and pages across Facebook and Instagram targeting Ukraine.

385.title: Mayank will lead Punjab Kings to successful IPL campaign: Kumble
385.article_body: After Mayank Agarwal was appointed as Punjab Kings captain, head coach Anil Kumble said he believes the opener will lead the franchise to a successful IPL campaign. "He is hardworking, enthusiastic, a team player with all the attributes required of a leader," Kumble added. With 441 runs from 12 matches, Mayank was the second-highest run-scorer for PBKS in IPL 2021.

386.title: Ukrainian woman soldier says 'I'm still alive, everything will be fine'; video viral
386.article_body: A video of a Ukrainian woman soldier has gone viral on social media, where she's saying, "I'm still alive, the sun is shining, the birds are singing...everything will be fine." The woman's identity and the original source of the video are unknown. Several people praised her courage while a tweet also read, "This is simultaneously so beautiful, and just heart-wrenching."

387.title: 42-yr-old tribal man flogged by police in J'khand; CM Soren orders inquiry
387.article_body: Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren has ordered an inquiry after pictures of a 42-year-old tribal man, who was allegedly flogged by the police in Latehar district for "dropping off Maoists" in the forest area, surfaced on social media. The victim alleged he was beaten till he fell unconscious. "Jharkhand Police, take immediate cognisance of the matter," the CM tweeted.

388.title: How many nuclear weapons does Russia have in comparison to other countries?
388.article_body: As per the data released by the Arms Control Association, a US-based nonpartisan organisation, Russia has the highest number of nuclear weapons at 6,257, followed by the US which has 5,550 of them. They are followed by China (350), France (290), the UK (225), Pakistan (165), India (156), Israel (90) and North Korea (40-50). Notably, Ukraine has no nuclear weapons.

389.title: 10 students from Maharashtra return to Pune from Ukraine
389.article_body: A batch of 10 students stuck in Ukraine returned to Pune by a special Air India flight on Sunday. The students are from different parts of Maharashtra. On reaching Pune, a 20-year-old student said, "We are fortunate enough to come back safely to our country as the third batch of students there are now facing a lot of problems."

390.title: Delhi Police sets up e-kiosk for contactless complaint registration
390.article_body: A digital e-kiosk has been set up at Delhi's Parliament Street police station to improve the interface between the public and the police, officials said on Sunday. The e-kiosk will enable people to easily lodge complaints in a contactless mode, they added. "The kiosk is very easy to access and senior citizens can...use it easily," a senior official said.

391.title: Wanted table reservation, no one knew me; no one had watched my film: Adarsh
391.article_body: 'The White Tiger' actor Adarsh Gourav said he got a "reality check" when he had to reserve a table at restaurant on Valentine's Day. "Every place was booked out...Someone suggested we pull strings...I made calls...and no one had even watched the film. Eventually, one place knew me. They gave me a table, that's because they weren't sold out," he said.

392.title: Irfan Pathan trolls Ravindra Jadeja for blinking too much during press conference
392.article_body: Former India all-rounder Irfan Pathan trolled Ravindra Jadeja for blinking too much during a press conference. Commenting on a video of Jadeja's press conference, Irfan tweeted, "Baapu needs eye drops." Responding to Irfan, Jadeja said that he was wearing lenses for the very first time. Irfan then joked the way he is batting, it seems he is wearing binoculars.

393.title: Latvia allows its citizens to fight in Ukraine amid Russian invasion
393.article_body: Latvian parliament on Monday voted unanimously to allow nationals to fight in Ukraine if willing amid the Russian invasion of the country. "Citizens who want to support Ukraine and...serve there to defend Ukraine's independence and our common security must be able to do so," a Latvian politician said. This comes a day after Latvia shut its airspace to Russian planes.

394.title: Ragpicker killed in Hyd due to chemical explosion in garbage bin
394.article_body: A 40-year-old woman ragpicker was killed due to a chemical explosion while segregating trash at a garbage bin in Hyderabad's Anandnagar on Sunday, police said. "A plastic tin containing unknown chemical exploded...[The deceased's] left hand was severed due to...blast and she died on the spot,” police added. The victim's husband, who was also picking up trash, survived the mishap.

395.title: North Korea says latest missile launch was to test cameras for satellite
395.article_body: North Korea has claimed that its missile launch on Sunday was part of a test for the development of a reconnaissance satellite system. The test helped confirm "the characteristics and working accuracy of a high-definition photographing system, data transmission system and altitude control devices", reported state media. Two photos showing the Korean Peninsula from space were also released.

396.title: SC to hear Cyrus Mistry's appeal to drop its remarks against him in 10 days
396.article_body: The Supreme Court on Monday agreed to hear former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry's appeal to expunge remarks made against him in the Court's 2021 verdict upholding Mistry's removal from the Tata Sons board. The plea said SC's remarks affect Mistry's "reputation, integrity and character". The Court said it will hear the plea in 10 days.

397.title: PM Modi is born in India to destroy demons, do welfare: Shivraj
397.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan said that Prime Minister Narendra Modi was born in India to "destroy demons and for the welfare of people". "PM Modi...has decided to send four union ministers to ensure that every single Indian is evacuated safely from Ukraine," he said, adding, "It was due to PM Modi that vaccines were made in India."

398.title: We are ready for IPO but the markets aren't: MobiKwik Co-founder
398.article_body: MobiKwik will not be heading for its ₹1,900 crore IPO in this quarter, Co-founder Upasana Taku told Business Insider. Citing the conflict between Russia and Ukraine, Taku said, "I don't think it will be possible for any tech companies to IPO anytime soon." She added, "We're ready. Business performance is strong, SEBI approval is there. But the markets aren't ready."

399.title: Kangana calls herself 'real talent', says 'No mafia can beat honest work'
399.article_body: Rangoli Chandel took to Instagram to share a new still from her sister, Kangana Ranaut's upcoming film, 'Dhaakad'. Sharing the post, Rangoli wrote, "Hope Kangana...breaks her own records with Dhaakad this year." Reacting to it, Kangana wrote on her Instagram Stories, "It's a fight about me versus them. No mafia, no paid PR can beat real talent and honest work."

400.title: Huge traffic at B'luru-Mysuru road due to Cong's Mekedatu rally
400.article_body: As the Karnataka Congress resumed the Mekedatu rally, the Bengaluru-Mysuru road reported traffic congestion and people were advised to avoid the route. The march, which was suspended in January due to a surge in COVID-19 cases, will end at National College Grounds in Bengaluru. It is led by Congress' state chief DK Shivakumar and Leader of Opposition Siddaramaiah.

401.title: Harrison Ford's 'Indiana Jones 5' wraps production, to release in 2023
401.article_body: Harrison Ford-starrer 'Indiana Jones 5' has finished its production, the makers announced on Sunday. The fifth instalment in the 'Indiana Jones' franchise, directed by James Mangold, will also feature Phoebe Waller-Bridge, Thomas Kretschmann, Antonio Banderas and Mads Mikkelsen, among others. The action-adventure film is expected to release on June 30, 2023.

402.title: Why does Russian military equipment in Ukraine have a ‘Z’ symbol on them?
402.article_body: A military source in Ukraine said that the ‘Z’ marking along with other symbols are painted on Russian military vehicles so that they aren't confused with Ukrainian vehicles and the risk of friendly fire is reduced. Military experts also believe the symbols are likely to be connected to the geographic location of where the units would be deployed for combat.
